name: undiagnosable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
An undiagnosable illness or condition is impossible to diagnose (= recognize and say exactly what it is): It was highly improbable for two or more children to die in infancy of undiagnosable natural causes. He is a hypochondriac and believes that every small physical problem is the sign of a dreadful, undiagnosable disease.
More examplesFewer examplesAs a mother whose child's illness is deemed undiagnosable, she is determined to find the cause. There are large numbers of undiagnosable people that suffer greatly but who medical doctors can find nothing wrong with and label psychosomatic.She starred as a suburban woman with an undiagnosable environmental illness.
